Create a point geometry

Source: R/gs_point.R
gs_point.Rd

Create a point geometry

gs_point(anchor = NULL, window = NULL, template = NULL,
  vertices = NULL, ...)

Arguments

anchor

[data.frame(1)]
Object to derive the geom from. It must include column names x, y and optinal variables such as fid; see Examples.
window

[data.frame(1)]
in case the reference window deviates from the bounding box of anchor (minimum and maximum values), specify this here.
template

[RasterLayer(1) | matrix(1)]
Gridded object that serves as template to sketch the geometry.
vertices

[integer(1)]
number of vertices.
...

[various]
graphical parameters to locate, in case points are sketched; see gpar.

Value

An invisible geom.

See also

Other shapes: gs_polygon, gs_random

Examples

library(magrittr)
#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘magrittr’
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:testthat’:
#> 
#>     equals, is_less_than, not

# create points programmatically
somePoints <- data.frame(X = c(5190599, 5222810, 5041066, 5234735,
                         5326537, 5027609, 5281527, 5189955), Y = c(3977612,
                         4060164, 3997230, 4117856, 4028167, 3971119, 4118207,
                         4062838))
(pointsGeom <- gs_point(anchor = somePoints)) %>%
  visualise(geom = ., linecol = "darkorange")


# NOT RUN {
input <- gtRasters$continuous

# create points interactively
myPoints <- gs_point(template = input, vertices = 5, col = "deeppink") %>%
  gt_group(, index = rep(1, 5))
anExtent <- gs_rectangle(myPoints)
visualise(geom = anExtent, linecol = "green", new = FALSE)
# }
